abstract: Venture capital financing grew 8 percent to $7.4 billion in the second quarter, with medical device companies taking the spotlight as the fastest growing sector, according to a report released Monday. Medical device start-ups walked away with $1 billion, a 58 percent increase over the year-ago period, the report issued by Ernst & Young and Dow Jones VentureOne said.
lead_paragraph: Venture capital financing grew 8 percent to $7.4 billion in the second quarter, with medical device companies taking the spotlight as the fastest growing sector, according to a report released Monday. Medical device start-ups walked away with $1 billion, a 58 percent increase over the year-ago period, the report issued by Ernst & Young and Dow Jones VentureOne said.

headline.main: V.C. Funding Grows 8% in Second Quarter
